name.text: Question 1

questiontext.text: A profile of your average user.

name.text: Question 1

questiontext.text: A CSS keyword that lets the user override the author’s style setting for a particular element.

name.text: Question 10

questiontext.text: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that omits the protocol and server name and only specifies the path to the file relative to one another on the same server.

name.text: Question 10

questiontext.text: An element that lets you change other aspects of a document that are not classified by elements, such as applying style rules to the first letter or first line of a paragraph.

name.text: Question 11

questiontext.text: The list of customer needs for a web site, such as search capability, tabbed menu navigation, specific color and branding requirements, or anything else that will create the desired outcome for the site.

name.text: Question 11

questiontext.text: The final stage of development by the W C, indicating that a technology release has been reviewed and tested extensively.

name.text: Question 12

questiontext.text: Communications software that allows transmission of encrypted secure messages over the Internet.

name.text: Question 12

questiontext.text: The part of a style rule that determines which HTML element to match.

name.text: Question 13

questiontext.text: Software that is distributed free so users can try it before they buy it. Users then can register the software for a relatively small fee compared to software produced commercially.

name.text: Question 13

questiontext.text: The basic unit of expression in CSS. It is composed of two parts: a selector and a declaration.

name.text: Question 14

questiontext.text: The design document for your web site.

name.text: Question 14

questiontext.text: A set of style rules that describes a document’s display characteristics.

name.text: Question 15

questiontext.text: A programming language that lets you select information from a database.

name.text: Question 15

questiontext.text: A CSS selector that applies a rule to every instance of the element in a document.

name.text: Question 16

questiontext.text: A classification and naming of content in a hierarchical structure.

name.text: Question 16

questiontext.text: A selector that lets you quickly select groups of elements and apply a style rule.

name.text: Question 17

questiontext.text: The global address of documents and other resources on the web.

name.text: Question 17

questiontext.text: The precise specification of a property in a style rule, based on the allowable values for the property.

name.text: Question 18

questiontext.text: A software emulator that acts like a physical computer.

name.text: Question 19

questiontext.text: The analysis of statistics that are gathered by web servers.

name.text: Question 2

questiontext.text: An address of documents and other resources on the web that includes the protocol the browser uses to access the file, service, domain name, the relative path, and the filename.

name.text: Question 2

questiontext.text: Style sheets originate from three sources: the author, the user, and the browser. This feature of CSS lets these multiple style sheets and style rules interact in the same document.

name.text: Question 20

questiontext.text: A computer connected to the Internet that runs server software. The software lets the computer use the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) to serve HTML files to web browser clients.

name.text: Question 21

questiontext.text: Web page mockups that represent page layouts for a web site.

name.text: Question 3

questiontext.text: A private part of a company’s intranet that uses the Internet to securely share part of an organization’s information.

name.text: Question 3

questiontext.text: An HTML element contained within another element.

name.text: Question 4

questiontext.text: A standard communications protocol for transferring files over the Internet.

name.text: Question 4

questiontext.text: The __________ portion of a style rule consists of a property name and value. The browser applies this to the selected element.

name.text: Question 5

questiontext.text: Programs available free of charge or with an optional donation fee.

name.text: Question 5

questiontext.text: The order of CSS rules dictating that child elements inherit rules from parent elements.

name.text: Question 6

questiontext.text: A company that provides Internet access and web site hosting services to individuals and organizations.

name.text: Question 6

questiontext.text: An HTML element that lets you establish document relationships, such as linking to an external style sheet.

name.text: Question 7

questiontext.text: A private collection of networks contained within an organization.

name.text: Question 7

questiontext.text: An HTML element that contains child elements.

name.text: Question 8

questiontext.text: A file system standard that supports computer operating systems such as Windows, classic Mac OS, and UNIX-like systems, to exchange data.

name.text: Question 8

questiontext.text: A quality or characteristic stated in a style rule, such as color, font-size, or margin. The is a part of the style rule declaration.

name.text: Question 9

questiontext.text: The number of times a web page is viewed by a user.

name.text: Question 9

questiontext.text: An element that selects elements based on characteristics other than their element name.

name.text: Which of the following is a part of Mobile First Strategy of Bootstrap?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a part of Mobile First Strategy of Bootstrap?

answer.text: Content: Determine what is most important.
Layout: Design to smaller widths first. Base CSS address mobile device first; media queries address for tablet, desktops.
Progressive Enhancement: Add elements as screen size increases.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap cross browser consistency?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap cross browser consistency?

answer.text: Bootstrap uses Normalize to establish cross browser consistency.
Normalize.css is a modern, HTML5-ready alternative to CSS resets.
Normalize.css is a small CSS file that provides better cross-browser consistency in the default styling of HTML elements.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Grid System?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Grid System?

answer.text: Rows must be placed within a .container class for proper alignment and padding.
Use rows to create horizontal groups of columns.
Content should be placed within the columns, and only columns may be the immediate children of rows.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Grid System?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Grid System?

answer.text: Predefined grid classes like .row and .col-xs-4 are available for quickly making grid layouts. LESS mixins can also be used for more semantic layouts.
Columns create gutters (gaps between column content) via padding. That padding is offset in rows for the first and the last column via negative margin on .rows.
Grid columns are created by specifying the number of twelve available columns you wish to span. For example, three equal columns would use three .col-xs-4.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Media Query?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Media Query?

answer.text: Media query is a really fancy term for "conditional CSS rule".
It simply applies some CSS, based on certain conditions set forth. If those conditions are met, the style is applied.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Media Query?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Media Query?

answer.text: Media queries have two parts, a device specification and then a size rule.
Media Queries in Bootstrap allow you to move, show and hide content based on the viewport size.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Mobile First Strategy?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Mobile First Strategy?

answer.text: You need to add the viewport meta tag to the element, to ensure proper rendering and touch zooming on mobile devices.
width property controls the width of the device. Setting it to device-width will make sure that it is rendered across various devices (mobiles,desktops,tablets.) properly.
initial-scale=1.0 ensures that when loaded, your web page will be rendered at a 1:1 scale, and no zooming will be applied out of the box.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Responsive Images?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap Responsive Images?

answer.text: Bootstrap 3 allows you to make the images responsive by adding a class ..img-responsive to the &lt.img&gt tag.
..img-responsive class applies max-width: 100%; and height: auto; to the image so that it scales nicely to the parent element.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap?

answer.text: Bootstrap is a sleek, intuitive, and powerful, mobile first front-end framework for faster and easier web development.
It uses HTML, CSS and Javascript.
Bootstrap was developed by Mark Otto and Jacob Thornton at Twitter.

name.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct about Bootstrap?

answer.text: Bootstrap's responsive CSS adjusts to Desktops,Tablets and Mobiles.
Provides a clean and uniform solution for building an interface for developers.
It contains beautiful and functional built-in components which are easy to customize.

name.text: Which of the following is the default layout of a bootstrap form?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is the default layout of a bootstrap form?

name.text: Which of the following is true about bootstrap help text?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is true about bootstrap help text?

answer.text: Bootstrap form controls can have a block level help text that flows with the inputs.
To add a full width block of content, use the .help-block after the &ltinput&gt.
